alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 11:11AM EDT until July 29 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Pork Fork Cumberland River at Cumberland affecting Harlan County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Pork Fork Cumberland River at Cumberland. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, River is at bankfull. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 10.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall to 5.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise to 5.4 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next statement will be issued 3 PM EDT.
